Mayor and City Council
======================

Agendas are available prior to the meetings. Minutes are available following approval.
[Most Recent Agenda](https://www.cityoflg.com/departments/documents.php)
|
[View All Agendas and Minutes](https://www.cityoflg.com/departments/documents.php)
La Grange is a Home Rule Charter City with an elected Mayor and City Council. The City Manager is hired by the City Council. The Mayor is elected at large and serves a two year term. The Council consists of 8 members, each serving 2 years. The City has
[4 Wards](https://www.cityoflg.com/LG_wards_2022.pdf?t=202203041427460)
with 2 Council members from each ward. One council member is elected each year from each ward. The fiscal year runs from October 1st through September 30th.
[City Council Ward Map](https://www.cityoflg.com/LG_wards_2022.pdf?t=202203041427460)

La Grange City Council is the governing body of the City of La Grange. Regular meetings are held on the second and fourth Monday at 6 p.m. in the City Council Chambers at 155 E. Colorado Street.
**The public may address the City Council briefly during the Citizen Participation portion of a regular meeting after completing a request to speak form prior to the start of the meeting.**

City Manager Jack Thompson

The City of La Grange conducts an officers’ election on the first Saturday in May of each year. A mayor and eight council members are elected for staggered two-year terms. Elections are held in the City Council Chambers, 155 E. Colorado.
